comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Captain Neil James Archibald Primrose, MC (December 14, 1882 – November 15, 1917), British Liberal politician and soldier, was the second son of Archibald Primrose, 5th Earl of Rosebery and Hannah de Rothschild, and brother of the writer Lady Sybil Grant. He was born at Dalmeny. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neil_Primrose_(politician)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The NYT article on May 6, 1913 { query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9404E7D91F3AE633A... } indicates that Neil Primrose M.P. [ seen here] and Charles Thomas Mills, M.P.[ www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3121125698/ ] were part of the British Committee invoved in planning celebrations of 100 years of peace among English-speaking peoples. Also at the meeting were Andrew Carnegie and Lord Weardale. See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3121126254/
